gao.tools

Class SQL

  • java.lang.Object
    • gao.tools.SQL

  • public class SQL
extends java.lang.Object
    This class helps to generate SQL code that considers index colums without the need to use JAXME_SQL
    Author:
    Joerg Roth

      • createIndexQuery

        public static java.lang.String createIndexQuery(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Geometry geometry,
                                boolean completelyInside)
                                         throws IndexException
        Creates an SQL condition that retrieves the geo objects that match the index conditions related to the given geometry. If completelyInside==true, only rows that are inside the given geometry are considered as candidates. However, as the index conditions are based on rectangles, in any case geometries have to checked later if the geometric conditions are hold.
        Throws:
        IndexException

      • createIndexQuery

        public static java.lang.String createIndexQuery(double mbr_w,
                                double mbr_n,
                                double mbr_e,
                                double mbr_s,
                                boolean completelyInside)
                                         throws IndexException
        Creates an SQL condition that retrieves the geo objects that match the index conditions related to the given bounding rectangle. If completelyInside==true, only rows that are inside the given geometry are considered as candidates. However, as the index conditions are based on rectangles, in any case geometries have to checked later if the geometric conditions are hold.
        Throws:
        IndexException

      • createIndexArray

        public static long[][][] createIndexArray(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Geometry geometry,
                          boolean completelyInside)
                                   throws IndexException
        Creates an array of indexes related to the given geometry. The result array is built as follows:
        • First dimension: result[0]: the array of indexes for Index1, result[1] for Index2
        • Second dimension: result[][i]: Index interval i for the respective index
        • Third dimension: result[][][0]: index from, result[][][1]: index to
        Each array element contains two longs (from index, to index). If completelyInside==true, only indexes that are inside the given geometry are considered as candidates. However, as the index conditions are based on rectangles, in any case geometries have to checked later if the geometric conditions are hold.
        Throws:
        IndexException

      • createIndexArray

        public static long[][][] createIndexArray(double mbr_w,
                          double mbr_n,
                          double mbr_e,
                          double mbr_s,
                          boolean completelyInside)
                                   throws IndexException
        Creates an array of indexes related to the given bounding rectangle. The result array is built as follows:
        • First dimension: result[0]: the array of indexes for Index1, result[1] for Index2
        • Second dimension: result[][i]: Index interval i for the respective index
        • Third dimension: result[][][0]: index from, result[][][1]: index to
        If completelyInside==true, only indexes that are inside the given geometry are considered as candidates. However, as the index conditions are based on rectangles, in any case geometries have to checked later if the geometric conditions are hold.
        Throws:
        IndexException
